prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing graduation greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "funny card"
Style: âœ¨ Smart Style
Tone: ðŸ˜„ Funny - humorous and lighthearted


Message: "Congratulations! You did it! I always knew you were smart, but now you have a fancy piece of paper to prove it. Welcome to the real world... we have snacks, but you have to pay for them now. So proud of you!"

Reference: "artistic transformation"

CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the humorous and lighthearted tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way
- Include visual humor, playful elements, and whimsical details





- Create cartoon/illustrated characters inspired by reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions

Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "graduation" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). I have included my own reference image. Create a stylized cartoon/illustrated character inspired by the reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions of real people, instead create charming cartoon-style characters with simplified, friendly features. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a charming and humorous caricature style, hand-drawn with colored pencils and a light watercolor wash. The illustration will exaggerate the graduate's key features from the reference photo in a playful and affectionate wayâ€”perhaps with a slightly oversized graduation cap perched jauntily on their head and an expression of comical relief and triumph. The linework will be loose and expressive, filled with personality, and the soft, layered colors will add warmth and a gentle, handmade feel. The background will be simple, with a few celebratory confetti shapes floating in soft, pastel hues, keeping the focus on the funny and endearing portrait of the new grad.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a graduation card with humorous and lighthearted tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a charming and humorous caricature style, hand-drawn with colored pencils and a light watercolor wash. The illustration will exaggerate the graduate's key features from the reference photo in a playful and affectionate wayâ€”perhaps with a slightly oversized graduation cap perched jauntily on their head and an expression of comical relief and triumph. The linework will be loose and expressive, filled with personality, and the soft, layered colors will add warmth and a gentle, handmade feel. The background will be simple, with a few celebratory confetti shapes floating in soft, pastel hues, keeping the focus on the funny and endearing portrait of the new grad.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Congratulations! You did it! I always knew you were smart, but now you have a fancy piece of paper to prove it. Welcome to the real world... we have snacks, but you have to pay for them now. So proud of you!" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Style: in a charming and humorous caricature style, hand-drawn with colored pencils and a light watercolor wash. The illustration will exaggerate the graduate's key features from the reference photo in a playful and affectionate wayâ€”perhaps with a slightly oversized graduation cap perched jauntily on their head and an expression of comical relief and triumph. The linework will be loose and expressive, filled with personality, and the soft, layered colors will add warmth and a gentle, handmade feel. The background will be simple, with a few celebratory confetti shapes floating in soft, pastel hues, keeping the focus on the funny and endearing portrait of the new grad.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a charming and humorous caricature style, hand-drawn with colored pencils and a light watercolor wash. The illustration will exaggerate the graduate's key features from the reference photo in a playful and affectionate wayâ€”perhaps with a slightly oversized graduation cap perched jauntily on their head and an expression of comical relief and triumph. The linework will be loose and expressive, filled with personality, and the soft, layered colors will add warmth and a gentle, handmade feel. The background will be simple, with a few celebratory confetti shapes floating in soft, pastel hues, keeping the focus on the funny and endearing portrait of the new grad.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover:
```json
{
  "frontCover": "Front cover of a graduation greeting card, 9:16 ratio. A stylized cartoon illustration of a cheerful young man in a graduation cap and gown, sitting on a stone railing. He is wearing a white dress shirt, a blue tie, a blue and yellow graduation stole, and black pants. He has a very wide, happy smile. Behind him is a classic building with columns, hinting at a university or school. Green trees and a bright blue sky with a few subtle stars or specks of light form the background. Scattered, soft confetti shapes in muted pastel colors are visible. The art style is reminiscent of hand-drawn colored pencil with a light watercolor wash, featuring loose, expressive linework and soft, layered colors. The overall mood is lighthearted and celebratory. The text 'Congratulations!' is artfully integrated into the upper-middle portion of the illustration, ensuring safe printing margins. The colors are dominated by blues, yellows, greens, and the warm tones of the character's skin and the building.",
  "backCover": "Back cover of a graduation greeting card, 9:16 ratio. A minimalist, serene decorative design that subtly references elements from the front cover. The background is a soft wash of light blue watercolor, evoking the sky. In the foreground, a simplified illustration of a single, stylized laurel leaf or a gentle abstract swirl in a muted gold or green hue is present, placed off-center. The overall aesthetic is clean, peaceful, and sophisticated, providing a sense of quiet closure to the card's visual story. The art style mirrors the front cover with loose linework and gentle watercolor textures.",
  "leftInterior": "Left interior of a graduation greeting card, 9:16 ratio. A charming and humorous caricature illustration in the style of hand-drawn colored pencils with a light watercolor wash. The focus is on a slightly exaggerated, playful interpretation of the graduating character from the front cover, perhaps shown mid-leap or with an oversized graduation cap. The scene could depict a symbolic representation of entering the 'real world,' such as a whimsical, slightly chaotic cityscape rendered with soft, muted colors, or a metaphorical path made of oversized puzzle pieces or stepping stones. Subtle visual cues like small, playful stars or confetti can be incorporated. The background is a soft blend of pastel watercolors, maintaining visual harmony with the front cover. The overall tone is lighthearted and imaginative, avoiding any explicit text or characters other than the stylized graduate.",
  "rightInterior": "Right interior of a graduation greeting card, 9:16 ratio. The central focus is the message: \"Congratulations! You did it! I always knew you were smart, but now you have a fancy piece of paper to prove it. Welcome to the real world... we have snacks, but you have to pay for them now. So proud of you!\" The text is presented in a clear, friendly, and slightly playful hand-written style, integrated into an innovative decorative artwork. This artwork could feature a playful, abstract composition of colorful shapes resembling confetti or symbolic academic elements like simplified book motifs or pathways, all rendered in the signature colored pencil and watercolor wash style. The colors are warm and inviting, with a gentle background wash. No people or characters are present. The design frames the message beautifully, creating an artistic and humorous culmination of the card's theme, while maintaining safe printing margins for the text."
}
```
generatedPrompts.backCover:
Here is the image generation prompt for the back cover of the greeting card, based on your provided description and the reference image:

Back cover design for a graduation greeting card, in a charming and humorous caricature style, hand-drawn with colored pencils and a light watercolor wash. The background is a simple, off-white parchment texture. On the right side of the frame, a stack of three books is depicted: the bottom book is a muted teal, the middle book is a warm, faded orange, and the top book is a soft, muted green. Perched jauntily on top of the green book is a small, dark green graduation cap with a subtle golden tassel. To the left of the books, a single, large feather is positioned vertically, detailed with intricate brown and tan stripes, giving it a realistic yet stylized appearance. The overall composition is clean and uncluttered, with ample negative space. There is no text or QR code present. The artistic style uses loose, expressive linework and soft, layered colors that create a gentle, handmade feel, complementing the tone of the card.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a graduation card with a charming and humorous caricature style, hand-drawn with colored pencils and a light watercolor wash. The artwork depicts a stylized, anthropomorphic brain character relaxing in a teacup, representing a "brain spa" or much-needed break. The brain has cucumber slices over its eyes, a white towel wrapped around its head, and is submerged in steaming, light blue water. Soft, pastel-colored clouds and musical notes are scattered around the brain, conveying a sense of calm and relaxation. The linework is loose and expressive, with soft, layered colors in muted earthy tones and pastel blues and greens, creating a warm and gentle, handmade feel. The background is a simple, creamy off-white, with subtle speckles, consistent with the hand-drawn aesthetic. This visual directly relates to the humor of "taking a break" and the intellectual effort of graduation, aligning with the "smart style" and humorous tone.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior:
Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a humorous and lighthearted tone. The central area is dominated by the message text "Congratulations! You did it! I always knew you were smart, but now you have a fancy piece of paper to prove it. Welcome to the real world... we have snacks, but you have to pay for them now. So proud of you!". The text is set in a friendly, slightly quirky, hand-drawn style with dark brown ink, resembling colored pencil lettering.

The message is visually integrated into a charming, whimsical diagram that illustrates a humorous "Real World Algorithm." Flanking the text on the left are hand-drawn icons: a diploma scroll connected by an orange arrow to a piggy bank with the text "GET DIPLOMA" below it, and further down, a contented, smiling yellow circle emoji connected by a blue arrow to a banner that reads "WEEKEND NAPS" above another banner labeled "NAPS". On the right side of the text, an orange arrow leads from the diploma to a box labeled "PRICEY SNACKS" overflowing with colorful candy. Below this, a teal arrow points to a small, grumpy blue monster with horns, labeled "BILLS". Another blue arrow originates from the "BILLS" monster and leads to a crumpled piece of paper labeled "WEEKEND NAPS".

The entire illustration is rendered in a flat 2D art style, reminiscent of hand-drawn colored pencil and light watercolor washes. The color palette is warm and muted, featuring soft yellows, muted oranges, greens, blues, and browns, creating a cohesive and inviting feel. The background is a simple, creamy off-white. Decorative green vines with small leaves gracefully frame the left and right edges of the entire interior spread, adding a touch of organic charm without overwhelming the central message. The overall composition is clean and organized, with ample negative space around the message for handwritten notes, while the illustrative elements effectively convey the humorous theme and act as visual cues for the celebratory message. The style is consistent with a caricature, with simplified, friendly features for the drawn elements.
